====31 August====
====31 August====
A 14-year-old boy was reportedly struck and killed by a [[tear gas]] canister while attending an anti-government demonstration in [[Sitra]] after morning prayers. Police said they were investigating how the boy died.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/08/2011831132740548678.html|agency=Al Jazeera English|date=31 August 2011|accessdate=31 August 2011|title=Bahraini boy killed in protest}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://blogs.voanews.com/breaking-news/2011/08/31/bahraini-police-fire-tear-gas-at-shiite-protesters-teenager-killed/|agency=Voice of America News|date=31 August 2011|accessdate=31 August 2011|title=Bahraini Police Fire Tear Gas at Shiâite Protesters, Teenager Killed}}</ref>
A 14-year-old boy was reportedly struck and killed by a [[tear gas]] canister while attending an anti-government demonstration in [[Sitra]] after morning prayers. Police said they were investigating how the boy died.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/08/2011831132740548678.html|agency=Al Jazeera English|date=31 August 2011|accessdate=31 August 2011|title=Bahraini boy killed in protest}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://blogs.voanews.com/breaking-news/2011/08/31/bahraini-police-fire-tear-gas-at-shiite-protesters-teenager-killed/|agency=Voice of America News|date=31 August 2011|accessdate=31 August 2011|title=Bahraini Police Fire Tear Gas at Shiâite Protesters, Teenager Killed}}</ref>
â
=== 1 September ===
  â
In what was the largest demonstration in months, thousands of people in Sitra marched in the funeral of the 14-year-old boy reportedly killed by a tear gas attack. Demonstrators held pictures of the boy and chanted, "Down, Hamad, down!" in reference to the Bahraini monarch.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/02/world/middleeast/02bahrain.html|agency=The New York Times|date=1 September 2011|accessdate=3 September 2011|first=J. David|last=Goodman|title=Large Protest in Bahrain After Boyâs Death}}</ref>
  â
